title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The amendment includes changes to the expected family contribution and the grant amount. Additionally, there are additional funds appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008 by $1,050. An additional $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for this purpose. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for the taxable year is now $3,750, with an increase in phaseout to $75,000 ($150,000). Conforming amendments have been made for taxable years beginning after 2007. The deduction for education loan interest has been increased to $3,750 for the taxable year, with a phaseout limit of $75,000 ($150,000) starting after 2007. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006, and the sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to certain sections related to student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. Repeal of sunset provision for certain tax relief act. The Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts under section 401 of the Act. SEC. 5. The sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to the extension of the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance.
